snippet: The clergy of Newtown, Conn., are preparing to bury 20 children, a wrenching task that includes helping secure tiny coffins and eulogizing lives that had just begun.
abstract: Small-town clergy of Newtown, Conn, are preparing to bury 20 children killed in elementary school shooting; wrenching tasks include purchase of child-size coffins and the preparation of eulogies for lives that had just begun; task is so overwhelming that 100 funeral directors from across the state have signed up work in shifts to help make and finalize arrangements.
lead_paragraph: The clergy of Newtown, Conn., are preparing to bury 20 children, a wrenching task that includes helping secure tiny coffins and eulogizing lives that had just begun.

headline.seo: In Newtown, Finding Words for a Mother Burying Her Boy
